message.content:
I need to identify the line item that represents the decrease in amounts owed to the entity for goods or services sold or provided on credit during the period.

In a cash flow statement, amounts owed to the entity for goods or services would be represented by Accounts Receivable. When Accounts Receivable increases, it means more money is owed to the company (which is a use of cash). When Accounts Receivable decreases, it means the company is collecting on those receivables (which is a source of cash).

Looking at the cash flow statement, I can see the line item "(Increase) Decrease in Accounts Receivable" with a value of "-200359.99". 

The negative sign here indicates an increase in accounts receivable (more money owed to the entity), rather than a decrease. This matches the standard presentation format where increases in receivables are shown as negative values on the cash flow statement because they represent cash outflows.

Therefore, the value I need to extract is "-200359.99".

```json
{"solution": {'value': '-200359.99'}}
```
